clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter, Placebo-Controlled Study Of Pregabalin For Pain Associated With Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter, Placebo-Controlled Study To Evaluate Efficacy And Safety Of Pregabalin (CI-1008) In The Treatment For Pain Associated With Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of pregabalin at 300 mg/day and 600 mg/day (BID) in patients with painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Study Endpoint in Mean Weekly Pain Scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 13 or up to study discontinuation (Study Endpoint)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline: Score at study endpoint minus score at baseline. Study endpoint is defined as the mean of the last seven entries of the daily pain diary using the 11-point numerical rating scale 0(no pain) to 10(worst possible pain) while on study medication up to and including day after last dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Study Endpoint in Mean Weekly Pain Scores by Groups of Subjects With Expected Similar Plasma Concentrations
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 13 or up to study discontinuation (Study Endpoint)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline: Score at study endpoint minus score at baseline. Study endpoint is defined as the mean of the last seven entries of the daily pain diary using the 11-point numerical rating scale 0(no pain) to 10(worst possible pain) while on study medication up to and including day after last dose. Subjects are classified by exposure to pregabalin, which is estimated by creatinine clearance (CLcr).

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 13 or up to study discontinuation (Study Endpoint)
primary_outcome.description: A responder is defined as a subject with a 50% reduction in weekly mean pain score from baseline to study endpoint.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline at Week 1 in Mean Weekly Pain Scores
primary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in mean weekly pain score from daily pain diary using the 11-point numerical rating scale 0(no pain) to 10(worst possible pain) at Week 1. Change from baseline: Score at Week 1 minus score at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression of Change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 13 or up to discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression of Change is a clinician-rated instrument that measures change in patient's overall status on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 13 or up to discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient Global Impression of Change is a patient-rated instrument that measures change in patient's overall status on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).

intervention.description: Dosage: placebo, oral administration, Treatment duration: 13 weeks (1-week titration and 12-week fixed dose)
Dosage: 300 mg/day (150 mg bid), oral administration, Treatment duration: 13 weeks (1-week titration and 12-week fixed dose)
Dosage: 600 mg/day (300 mg bid), oral administration, Treatment duration: 13 weeks (1-week titration and 12-week fixed dose)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) of pain is higher than 40 mm.
- Diagnosis of type 1 or 2 diabetes mellitus for at least 1 year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Malignancy within the past 2 years.
- Neurologic disorders unrelated to diabetic neuropathy that may confuse the assessment of neuropathy pain

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: After a 1-week baseline phase, subjects were classified into 2 strata based on creatinine clearance (CLcr) values (Low: 30 <CLcr <=60 mL/minute; Normal: CLcr > 60 mL/minute) and were each randomly assigned to 1 of 3 treatment groups.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: During a 13-week double-blind phase, subjects received matching placebo.

group.title: Pregabalin 300 mg/Day
group.description: During a 13-week double-blind phase, after 1 week of up titration, subjects received pregabalin 300 mg/day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Pregabalin 600 mg/Day
group.description: During a 13-week double-blind phase, after 1 week of up titration, subjects with low CLcr received pregabalin 300 mg/day and subjects with normal CLcr received pregabalin 600 mg/day for 12 weeks.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Study Endpoint in Mean Weekly Pain Scores by Groups of Subjects With Expected Similar Plasma Concentrations
outcome.description: Change from baseline: Score at study endpoint minus score at baseline. Study endpoint is defined as the mean of the last seven entries of the daily pain diary using the 11-point numerical rating scale 0(no pain) to 10(worst possible pain) while on study medication up to and including day after last dose. Subjects are classified by exposure to pregabalin, which is estimated by creatinine clearance (CLcr).
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 13 or up to study discontinuation (Study Endpoint)
outcome.population: Full analysis set. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: During a 13-week double-blind phase, subjects received matching placebo.

group.title: Expected Exposure Pregabalin 300 mg/Day
group.description: During a 13-week double-blind phase, after 1 week of up titration, subjects with normal CLcr in the pregabalin 300 mg/day group received pregabalin 300 mg/day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Expected Exposure Pregabalin 600 mg/Day
group.description: During a 13-week double-blind phase, after 1 week of up titration, subjects with low CLcr in the pregabalin 300 and 600 mg/day groups received pregabalin 300 mg/day and subjects with normal CLcr in the pregabalin 600 mg/day group received pregabalin 600 mg/day for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Study Endpoint in Mean Weekly Pain Scores by Groups of Subjects With Expected Similar Plasma Concentrations
measure.description: Change from baseline: Score at study endpoint minus score at baseline. Study endpoint is defined as the mean of the last seven entries of the daily pain diary using the 11-point numerical rating scale 0(no pain) to 10(worst possible pain) while on study medication up to and including day after last dose. Subjects are classified by exposure to pregabalin, which is estimated by creatinine clearance (CLcr).
measure.population: Full analysis set. Last observation carried forward.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of <60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), <12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
